intro.p: A {{account}} has \${{amount}} in it initially. It earns interest at a rate of {{APR}}\%, compounded {{compounding}}. The amount in the account after {{var}} years is modeled by the function {{f}}, where P represents the initial amount, r represents the interest rate, and n is the number of times per year interest is compounded.

A population of {{creatures}} is growing exponentially, with the popultation after t {{units}} modeled by the equation {{f}}, where a is the initial population and b is the growth rate. Suppose that there are initially {{amount}} {{creatures}}, and after {{x0}} {{units}}, there are {{y0}} {{creatures}}.

A {{asset}} is initially valued at \${{amount}}, and depreciates at a rate of {{APR}}\% each year. The value of the {{asset}} after t years is modeled by the equation {{f}}, where A is the initial value and r represents the annual rate of depreciation.

The isotope {{isotope}} has a half-life of {{half_life}} {{time_units}}. A scientist has a sample of {{amount}} {{units}} of {{isotope}}, which decays radioactively according to the model {{f}}, where A is the initial amount, and h is the half-life.
